titleStmt.title: The mysteries of Mount Calvary Made by the reverend father in God, lord Anthonie de Gueuara, bishop of Mondonnedo, preacher and chronicler, vnto Charles the fift, Emperour. In this booke the authour handleth all the mysteries, of the Mount of Caluarie, from the time that Christ was condemned by Pilat, vntill he was put into the sepulchre, by Ioseph and Nichodemus.
Monte Calvario. Part 1. English
titleStmt.author: Guevara, Antonio de, Bp., d. 1545?

titleStmt.title: The mysteries of Mount Calvary Made by the reverend father in God, lord Anthonie de Gueuara, bishop of Mondonnedo, preacher and chronicler, vnto Charles the fift, Emperour. In this booke the authour handleth all the mysteries, of the Mount of Caluarie, from the time that Christ was condemned by Pilat, vntill he was put into the sepulchre, by Ioseph and Nichodemus.
Monte Calvario. Part 1. English
titleStmt.author: Guevara, Antonio de, Bp., d. 1545?

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Adam Islip, for Edward White, and are to be sold at the little North dore of Paules, at the signe of the Gunne,

notesStmt.note: A translation of part 1 of: Monte Calvario.
Running title reads: The mysteries of Mount Caluary.
Caption title on p. 1: Here beginneth the booke, called The Mount of Caluarie, ... .
Reproduction of original in the Peterborough Cathedral, Peterborough, England.
Filmed copy misbound and missing quire P.
